title: Richest candidate in Mumbai? Bharatiya Janata Party’s Parag Shah declares assets of ₹690 crore | mumbai news | Hindustan Times
text:
Richest candidate in Mumbai? Bharatiya Janata Party’s Parag Shah declares assets of ₹690 crore mumbai Updated: Feb 08, 2017 15:06 IST Hindustan Times Shah, a real estate developer, is one of the richest candidates contesting the BMC elections.(HT Photo) 
Contesting the civic polls for the first time, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) candidate Parag Shah declared assets worth Rs690 crore in an affidavit attached to his nomination form. Shah, a real estate developer, is said to be one of the richest candidates contesting the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections slated to be held on February 21. 
He will contest opposite Congress heavyweight Pravin Chheda in ward 132 of the Gujarati-dominated eastern suburb of Ghatkopar. A BJP functionary said Shah is well-known among the region’s Jain community. 
In his affidavit, Shah has declared his family’s movable and immovable assets. 
He is the managing director of Man Infraconstruction, which has undertaken real estate projects in parts of Mumbai. He also owns three houses in Ghatkopar. His wife, Mansi, has one house in her name in Ghatkopar and another in Thane, the affidavit reveals. 
Shah is considered to be close to local MLA and state housing minister Prakash Mehta, who helped him get this ticket. Interestingly, Chheda was a BJPmember earlier, but deflected to the Congress citing differences with Mehta. tags
